entries.title: US holiday travel upended as forecasters warn of 'bomb cyclone'
entries.description: The frigid air was moving Thursday through the central United States to the east, with windchill advisories affecting about 135 million people over the coming days. Temperatures are plummeting 50 degrees Fahrenheit in some areas.

entries.title: January 6 investigation's key witness recounts pressure from Trump allies
entries.description: In a testimony to the January 6 committee made public Thursday, Former White House aide Cassidy Hutchinson describes attempts to influence her cooperation with Congress, including her own lawyer telling her 'the less you remember, the better.'

entries.title: US Congress clears first hurdle for $1.7 trillion spending deal
entries.description: US senators approved an annual spending package Thursday that includes $45 billion in Ukraine aid and reforms to election law. The House minority leader urged Republican lawmakers to vote against it but the spending bill passed by 68 votes to 29.

entries.title: Delayed France-Germany summit to be held in January
entries.description: The meeting between the two governments was cancelled in October as they struggled to find common ground.

entries.title: To keep the Christmas spirit alive, some parents are going to greater lengths than others
entries.description: Parents are sometimes more attached to Christmas fairytales and the idea of Father Christmas than their children are. To keep the magic going for as long as possible, some are resorting to particularly elaborate scenarios.

entries.title: Michel Houellebecq and the far-right radicalization of a best-selling author
entries.description: In an interview, the writer rehashed white supremacist talking points, speaking of the 'Great Replacement' theory and violent 'acts of resistance' against Muslims.

entries.title: After US trip, Zelensky meets Poland's Duda on way back to Ukraine
entries.description: The Ukrainian president said the two leaders 'discussed strategic plans for the future' during his short visit to Poland.

entries.title: UN experts point to Rwandan role in east DR Congo rebel crisis
entries.description: A report by a group of independent investigators found that there was 'substantial evidence' of direct Rwandan army intervention in the east of the Democratic Republic of Congo.

entries.title: Spain institutional crisis 'set to last' after court blocks judicial reform
entries.description: Conservatives and socialists have been in a bitter dispute over control of judicial appointments.

entries.title: Protesters shut luxury Paris store La Samaritaine
entries.description: Trade unions and employees protested at the luxury shop in central Paris, though management denied any employees were involved.

entries.title: 'Qatargate': 'The EU is neglecting to implement criminal prohibitions to defend its democracy'
entries.description: While the Belgian justice system is at work on the 'Qatargate' scandal, the same cannot be said of the European justice system, which has no means of prosecuting non-financial corruption, explains lawyer Juliette Lelieur.

entries.title: Some 2,000 asylum seekers will sleep rough on Brussels' streets this winter
entries.description: Between 2,000 and 3,000 asylum seekers are sleeping in small tents or on cardboard boxes in Brussels.

entries.title: Zelensky visit to Washington cements alliance between Kyiv and the United States
entries.description: 'Your money is not charity. It's an investment in global security and democracy,' the Ukrainian president said in a speech to members of Congress.

entries.title: China tries to downplay number of Covid-19 deaths
entries.description: Crematoriums are overflowing in Beijing and other major cities as the number of deceased continues to grow.

entries.title: 'Qatargate': Eva Kaili's lawyers seek release in EU Parliament corruption scandal
entries.description: Lawyers for the former European Parliament vice president asked that she be released with a tracking device.

entries.title: Neymar and Marquinhos follow Mbappé back to PSG training
entries.description: The two players were part of Brazil's squad that was knocked out in the quarterfinal against Croatia.

entries.title: Men allowed to compete in artistic swimming at Paris 2024 Olympics
entries.description: Two men will be allowed per team, as has already been the case at world championships since 2015.

entries.title: Tired and angry British healthcare workers confront government
entries.description: Nurses and ambulance workers are ready for a hard and long standoff, but Downing Street is still looking away.

entries.title: Macron on Ukraine: 'I don't want the Chinese and Turks to be the only ones negotiating the day after'
entries.description: The French president told 'Le Monde' he backed a strategy of 'absolute defense of Ukraine', although he is also keen to anticipate the end of the conflict.

entries.title: Ukraine: Zelensky looks to win war of symbols
entries.description: By visiting Washington, the Ukrainian president wanted to thank the United States. He will probably be eager to pay the same tribute to his European allies.

entries.title: Netanyahu forms Israel's most right-wing government ever
entries.description: The prime minister was forced to make major concessions to his far-right allies, including Jewish supremacist Itamar Ben Gvir.

entries.title: COP15 on biodiversity: Five women share their commitment to protecting nature
entries.description: Five participants from different countries at the UN Biodiversity Conference, which ended on December 19, explained the reasons behind their commitment to 'Le Monde.'

entries.title: Terry Hall, lead singer of The Specials and emblem of British ska
entries.description: Born in Coventry, the iconic lead vocalist of the British band The Specials died on Sunday, December 18, aged 63.

entries.title: Indonesia's new morally strict criminal code sparks debate
entries.description: The government has come out in defense of the new code adopted by parliament on Tuesday, December 6, which penalizes sexual relations outside of marriage.

entries.title: Argentina's government defends messy World Cup parade
entries.description: The World Cup winners had to be airlifted by helicopter after massive crowds brought their bus parade to a standstill.

entries.title: India brings diplomats on tour of nationalist's prison cell
entries.description: As India prepared to take the G20 presidency, officials imposed on foreign delegations a visit to the cell of Vinayak Damodar Savarkar, an icon of Hindu nationalists imprisoned by the British.

entries.title: France fines Microsoft €60 million over advertising cookies
entries.description: France's data privacy watchdog said the US company needed to do a better job at letting users of its search engine refuse cookies.

entries.title: The Patriot system, a symbol of 'American power projection'
entries.description: Washington confirmed delivery to Kyiv of one of these surface-to-air missile systems on Wednesday, December 22.

entries.title: 'Serpent' serial killer expected to be released in Nepal
entries.description: Charles Sobhraj, a 78-year-old French national who committed a string of murders across Asia in the 1970s, is to be released early on health grounds. A court ordered that he be deported within 15 days.

entries.title: Brazil football legend Pelé to spend Christmas in hospital
entries.description: Considered by many to be the greatest footballer of all time, the 82-year-old is receiving treatment for worsening cancer as well as kidney and heart problems.

entries.title: How dependent is Europe on Qatar for its gas supplies?
entries.description: The emirate is the European Union's second-largest supplier of liquefied natural gas (LNG), but it is losing momentum as the US grabs market share.

entries.title: French hospitals now handle Covid-19 patients like they have just another disease
entries.description: With the end of dedicated units, caregivers are adapting and learning to manage the infectious risk of patients with SARS-CoV-2.

entries.title: At Jordan summit, Arab countries and France warn Iraq against Iranian influence
entries.description: The meeting held on the shores of the Dead Sea, which brought together twelve countries of the region, including the enemies Saudi Arabia and Iran, did not produce any results.

entries.title: US: January 6 panel prepares to unveil final report on insurrection
entries.description: 'The central cause of January 6th was one man, former President Donald Trump, who many others followed,' reads the report expected to be released in full on Thursday.

entries.title: Trump paid no federal tax while president in 2020
entries.description: Former President Donald Trump paid $1.1 million in federal taxes in the middle two years of his presidency, according to a report scrutinized by lawmakers Wednesday, but almost nothing for the rest of his time in the White House.

entries.title: Ukraine President Zelensky to US Congress: 'Your money is not charity, it's an investment in global security'
entries.description: Just before his arrival, the US announced a $1.8 billion military aid package for Ukraine, including for the first time Patriot surface-to-air missiles. This is the first trip abroad for Mr. Zelensky since Russia invaded in February.

entries.title: FTX founder extradited to the US to face charges
entries.description: Bahamas' attorney general's office said that Sam Bankman-Fried would be leaving on Wednesday, noting he had waived his right to challenge the extradition. He faces criminal charges related to the collapse of the cryptocurrency exchange.

entries.title: The thrilling discovery of a portrait under a Cézanne painting
entries.description: The Cincinnati Art Museum in Ohio has announced that using X-rays it has detected a man's face underneath 'Still Life with Bread and Eggs,' painted in 1865.
